title: Great Caribbean travel deals you need to grab now
text:
By Robert Curley Updated October 28, 2016 . 
A Caribbean vacation is a priceless experience -- but there's no need to overpay. High season or low , there are good values to be had on island resorts and package deals that combine airfare and accommodations for one discounted price. Plus, more resorts than ever are offering free nights on extended stays, and destination-wide deals often include discounts on dining and activities that can cut down on the cost of your trip even further. 
Here's our top picks of the current Caribbean travel deals you can take advantage of right now! Breezes Bahamas all-inclusive resort. © SuperClubs 1. Fall for Breezes Sale 
Now through Nov. 15, travelers who book a Breezes vacation through the end of the year (including Christmas and New Years weeks), will instantly save 40 percent on stays. Plus, now through Oct. 31, guests who book three nights receive $100 in Breezes Bucks (per room), and those staying four nights or more receive $150 in Breezes Bucks (per room). Breezes Bucks can be used for services or merchandise at the spa, gift shop, cabana rentals, late check-out and room upgrades. Rates start at $129 per person, per night, double occupancy. 
continue reading below our video Before Your Road Trip, Watch This The Mayan Temple at the Atlantis Aquaventure water park, Paradise Island, Bahamas. © Kerzner International 2. All-Inclusive Atlantis 
A la carte costs have always been a wild card at Atlantis : even when you can get a good room deal, spending on activities and meals can quickly add up. While it ain't cheap, the all-inclusive experience being offered on stays at the Royal Towers and Beach Tower at least give you some cost-certainty when planning a visit to Paradise Island. 
The All-Inclusive Experience starts at $299 per person per night ($99 per night for kids) and includes your room, meals, activities, gratuities, surcharges and resort fees, resort taxes on rooms, basic Wi-Fi, and cover charges at bars and lounges. The offer can be booked through Dec. 20, 2016 for travel through June 16, 2017. 
Not quite what you're looking for? Consider the Atlantis' Early Bird Special, which combines off-season rates with resort credits of up to $450 on stays between Dec. 26, 2016 and June 21, 2017. Guests who stay three or four nights at the Royal Towers receive $200 resort credit; those who stay at The Cove will receive $250. For a stay of five nights or more, receive $300 resort credit when staying at Royal Towers or $450 at The Cove. Starting rates are $239 per room per night.
